abstract: In the autumn of 2005, Michael D. Eisner worked his last day as chief executive of Walt Disney. His ubiquitous mug and wide grin came to embody the company almost as much as Mickey Mouse, making him a public personality in his own right.
lead_paragraph: In the autumn of 2005, Michael D. Eisner worked his last day as chief executive of Walt Disney. His ubiquitous mug and wide grin came to embody the company almost as much as Mickey Mouse, making him a public personality in his own right.

headline.main: After Disney, Eisner Finds a Home Online
